questions.question: Do you feel preoccupied with the Internet (think about previous online activity or anticipate next online session)?
Do you feel the need to use the Internet with increasing amounts of time in order to achieve satisfaction?
Have you repeatedly made unsuccessful efforts to control, cut back, or stop Internet use?
Do you feel restless, moody, depressed, or irritable when attempting to cut down or stop Internet use?
Do you stay online longer than originally intended?
Have you jeopardized or risked the loss of significant relationship, job, educational or career opportunity because of the Internet?
Have you lied to family members, therapist, or others to conceal the extent of involvement with the Internet?
Do you use the Internet as a way of escaping from problems or of relieving a dysphoric mood
Do you make a list of the things that you have to do each day?
Do you make a schedule of the activities that you have to do on work days?
Do you plan the day before you start it?
Do you write a set of goals for yourself for each day?
Do you get a clear idea of what you want to accomplish during the next week?
Do you spend some time each day for planning?
How often do you set and honor priorities?
Do you continue unprofitable routines or activities ?
Do you believe that there is room for improvement in the way you manage your time?
How often do you find yourself doing things which interfere with your college work simply because you hate to say No to people?
Do you feel you are in charge of your own time, by and large?
On an average class day do you spend more time with personal grooming than doing college work?
How often do you make constructive use of time?
How often are you working on a major assignment, a night before it’s due date?
Do you set goals for the entire quarter?
Do you keep your desk clear of everything other than what you are currently working on?
When you have several things to do, how often do you think it is best to do a little bit of work on each one?
Do you review your class notes, even when a test is not about to happen in near future?
Do you worry about Results after an Examination?
Do you panic before and during a test?
Do you have visible signs of nervousness such as sweaty palms, shaky hands, and so on right before a test ?
Do you have “butterflies” feeling in your stomach before a test?
Do you feel nauseated before a test?
Do you read through the test and feel that you do not know any of the answers?
Does your mind goes blank during a test?
Do you remember the blanked out information once you get out of the Testing Situations?
Do you have trouble sleeping the night before a test?
Do you make mistakes on easy questions or put answers in the wrong places?
Do you have trouble choosing answers?
Does thinking about your future career feel scary?
Do you feel nervous when others ask you about your career plans?
Do you feel confident when talking about your occupational goals?
Do you feel worried when you make career-related decisions?
Do you feel secure when you contemplate your career goals?
Does thinking about your resume makes you feel stressed?
Do you enjoy thinking about your future career?
Do you worry about committing to a career choice?
Do you worry about not being able to find a job?
Do you feel nervous about choosing a career?
Do you feel concerned about having limited employment opportunities?
Do you feel afraid of being dissatisfied with your chosen career?
